name: Portsmouth Brewing Co
description: The Portsmouth Brewing Company is Ohio’s oldest operating brewery, built in 1843. The PBC has revived a classic recipe from the 1840′s in Red Bird Ale, a version of the local steam ale. Also kept alive are the fundamental German style lagers brewed here after the civil war in Portsmouth Pilsner and Crystal Gold Lager.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Summer Hours: 
    Monday-Thursday 11am-10pm
    Friday & Saturday 11am-11pm
    Sunday 12noon-10pm

Winter Hours:
    Monday-Thursday 11am-9pm
    Friday & Saturday 11am-10pm
    Sunday 12noon-9pm

Tours: FREE Brewery Tours in 2012 on the 1st and 3rd Saturday of every month at 5pm.  Tours are free to the public and include PBC Brewery History, Brewing 101 and a Question & Answer session.  After the tour, a beer tasting of the current PBC craft brews will be held.
